intro: Chastenaea longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf chastetree, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, elliptical leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
